go_data.justification: rab-3 mutants have been shown to have defects in SV tethering.
Direct interactions between C. elegans RAB-3 and Rim provide a mechanism to target vesicles to the presynaptic density.
Regulation of synaptic transmission by RAB-3 and RAB-27 in Caenorhabditis elegans.
Differences in the distribution of SVs relative to the presynaptic density can also lead to reduced SV exocytosis and thus aldicarb resistance, as seen in rab-3 mutants.
